# controlSize

**Instance Property**

The size of the cell.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var controlSize: NSControl.ControlSize { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to change the rendered size of the cell and its control. For a list of possible values, see [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSControl/ControlSize-swift.enum].

Changing the cell’s control size does not change the font used by the cell. Use the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFont/systemFontSize(for:)] class method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFont] to obtain an appropriate font based on the new control size.

## Determining Cell Size

- **calcDrawInfo(_:)**: Recalculates the cell geometry.
- **cellSize**: The minimum size needed to display the cell.
- **cellSize(forBounds:)**: Returns the minimum size needed to display the receiver, constraining it to the specified rectangle.
- **drawingRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle within which the receiver draws itself
- **imageRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its image.
- **titleRect(forBounds:)**: Returns the rectangle in which the receiver draws its title text.
